column13: > LEGO Marvel Super Heroes returns to the Polybag scene with some great micro model versions of vehicles. Our first offering is from Black Panther and it looks awesome.

column16: >Captures the look of the vehicle quite nicely in this small scale.
>Build is sweet and fun, model makes a great swooshable craft and will fit on the SHIELD Helicarrier quite nicely.
>Difficult to locate at retail, especially with TRU closing their American and United Kingdom branches.

column8: >I am a huge fan of the Marvel and DC Polybags that make smaller versions of the larger vehicles, and this set is one of the best offerings from them. They do a much better job with these types of Polybags compared to the ones that include Minifigures half the time, and so I definitely recommend this set if you can get it.

column1: Nothing really special just the normal bag from a polybag. Instructions are the normal small folded ones.
Surprisingly this set has some cool pieces for a polybag. You get 10 of Star Lords blasters on the sides of the ship. Also some of the trans-purple pieces are nice to get
The build was really simple took me 1-2
When it was finished it resembled the larger version of it. Cool mini version of the Royal Talon Fighter.

column2: s another great Marvel polybag. I enjoy collecting these mini ships and vehicles from Marvel, DC, and Star Wars. This is definitely one of my favorites that I own. Overall I&#39
